image.altText: A thick cloud of smoke rises from a burning, tree-lined hillside behind a rural property.

props.synopsis: Authorities are continuing to battle out-of-control bushfires across Victoria, which have already claimed dozens of properties. Meanwhile, extreme heatwave warnings remain in place for NSW, ACT and WA. Follow live.

title.children: Fire authorities seeking US, Canadian help to fight Victorian bushfires; Cyclone Koji crossing Queensland coast

image.altText: Stormy tropical beach

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Koji is expected to make landfall between Ayr and Bowen, according to the weather bureau.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Koji 'very close to mainland' as crossing begins

image.altText: The state of Queensland with a stylised cyclone diagram, and a line chart tracking upward.

props.synopsis: Track the path of Tropical Cyclone Koji and monitor wind speeds as the system makes landfall in northern Queensland.

title.children: Track Tropical Cyclone Koji live as it crosses Australia's coastline

image.altText: Eloise Worledge

props.synopsis: Fifty years after Beaumaris schoolgirl Eloise Worledge vanished, could new leads solve one of Australia's most haunting cold cases?

title.children: 'Only thing missing is my eight-year-old daughter': Father's chilling report

image.altText: President Donald Trump speaks during a news conference

props.synopsis: While debate rages over the legality and the potential fallout from America's incursion, there's been a quiet acceptance that it is all about oil.

title.children: Has Trump landed a dud with his Venezuelan oil play?

image.altText: Donald Trump points his finger while partially poking his tongue out

props.synopsis: There have been plenty of examples of the Trump administration's contempt for legalities, diplomacy and alliances, but this week Trump and his lieutenants went further.

title.children: The rhetoric of the Trump administration has taken a chilling turn

image.altText: Eddie Scott stands at a lectern while speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: A man is charged with murder after six people from the same family were killed in a series of shootings.

title.children: Six dead, including child, in Mississippi shootings, suspect charged

image.altText: Three young people stand together

props.synopsis: Survivors of a secretive Christian sect, under investigation by the FBI, say it is hiding wealth through trusts, blocking access to abuse compensation.

title.children: Christian sect investigated by the FBI under pressure to reveal wealth

image.altText: Two Afghan children sit inside a tent staring out at the tents before them.

props.synopsis: Four years after the Taliban's return to power, security is no longer the defining issue in Afghanistan. Instead, one of the world's worst humanitarian crises is exacerbated by a series of overlapping disasters.

title.children: The ABC was granted access to Afghanistan. This is what we saw

image.altText: Arsenal players with a team shirt showing respect for Kyra Cooney-Cross's mother.

props.synopsis: Arsenal players and supporters pay emotional tributes to Matildas star Kyra Cooney-Cross following her return to Australia to be with her mother, who has been diagnosed with cancer.

title.children: Arsenal shows support for Cooney-Cross in wake of mother's cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Usman Khawaja pulls

props.synopsis: Usman Khawaja's international career may be over, but he showed he is far from a spent force by stroking a fine 78 to help the Brisbane Heat to a BBL victory.

title.children: Khawaja stars as Heat thrash Thunder, Warner injured

image.altText: Marta Kostyuk smiles

props.synopsis: Marta Kostyuk crushed world number six Jessica Pegula in less than an hour after Aryna Sabalenka powered past Karolína Muchová to reach a third consecutive Brisbane International final.

title.children: Ukrainian underdog sets up Sabalenka final with 55-minute annihilation

image.altText: Iga Swiatek and Coco Gauff shakje hands at the net at the United Cup.

props.synopsis: Coco Gauff gets on top of Iga Świątek ahead of the Australian Open, but the US star fails to stop Poland from reaching the United Cup final in Sydney.

title.children: Gauff beats Świątek but Poland advances to United Cup final

image.altText: A graphic of a Barbie's side profile layered on top of the side profiles of two women with Barbie nose rhinoplasties.

props.synopsis: Tiny, sloped rhinoplasties are dominating pop culture. But some plastic surgery experts say "trend-associated" procedures like these are a concern.

title.children: 'I would look like an alien': The rise of the 'Barbie nose' trend

image.altText: A police vehicle leaves a rural property during the search for Kenneth Giles near Mullewa.

props.synopsis: A search and rescue specialist details the significant hurdles faced by police as the manhunt for an alleged gunman in Western Australia's Midwest enters its fifth day.

title.children: Challenges faced by police in hunt for alleged Mullewa gunman

image.altText: A thief in a light-coloured hoodie holds a hammer and smashes a glass cabinet.

props.synopsis: For years, a prestigious trophy that represented Australia's ties to Italian high fashion took pride of place in a Tasmanian museum. But it is now missing after a 'targeted' overnight robbery.

title.children: Mystery grips village after 'priceless' trophy fleeced from museum

image.altText: A large crowd of people carrying drums, trumpets and other instruments in the middle of a road.

props.synopsis: Wollongong’s collective of brass and wind bands have been putting on a show for locals for almost a century, but it is one of dozens of community bands across the state that faces an uncertain future due to a recent loss of funding.

title.children: 'Significant' impact for community bands as funding applications rejected

image.altText: A picture of the sunset over a glistening wetland

props.synopsis: In a remote and isolated part of NSW, nature is enjoying a deluge of water still around from floods in Queensland last year.

title.children: Wetland teeming with life in this remote Corner Country of NSW

image.altText: A young woman looks at the camera while singing in a darkened room.

props.synopsis: Pop and MTV ruled supreme but 1986 was also a banner year for hip hop and metal.

title.children: 1986 in music: The big albums turning 40 this year

image.altText: An electronic billboard about 'The Very Hungry Wall'.

props.synopsis: A concrete wall built on the picturesque waterfront of a small Tasmanian town has prompted confusion and concern from residents.

title.children: A Tasmanian council built a wall. It hasn't gone down well

image.altText: A sign saying "Adelaide Writers Week" in front of a park.

props.synopsis: Nearly a dozen former leaders of the Adelaide Festival are calling for Randa Abdel-Fattah to be reinvited to Writers' Week, adding to a mounting crisis over the Palestinian-Australian author's exclusion from the literary festival.

title.children: Former Adelaide Festival leaders label Palestinian author's exclusion 'grave mistake'

image.altText: A man plays a guitar with a drumkit behind him. He is in a building made of corrugated iron and timber, with a yellow XXXX sign.

props.synopsis: The Indonesian priest brings a deep love of rock'n'roll to his pastoral care in western NSW.

title.children: From sermons to guitar solos: Indonesian priest's unlikely pulpit is rock'n'roll

image.altText: Jessica Hull celebrates Australia's win in the mixed relay event at the World Athletics Cross Country Championships.

props.synopsis: Olympic medallist Jessica Hull guides Australia home in the mixed relay event at the world titles in Florida.

title.children: Hull anchors Australia to World Cross Country Championships gold

image.altText: Bree Walker competing in the monobob event at a World Cup event in Switzerland.

props.synopsis: With the Winter Olympics on the horizon, Bree Walker proves she is among the medal favourites in the monobob with a World Cup victory in Switzerland.

title.children: Aussie bobsleigh star Walker claims historic win ahead of Winter Olympics

image.altText: Paawan Sharma holding a cricket ball.

props.synopsis: After an Ashes series dominated by pace bowlers, what does the future hold for young spinners wanting to play Test cricket for Australia?

title.children: Is spin bowling a dying art in Australian cricket?

image.altText: Wrexham players celebrate during FA Cup win over Nottingham Forest.

props.synopsis: As actor and co-owner Ryan Reynolds watched on in the grandstand, Wrexham defeated Nottingham Forest on penalties to advance to the fourth round of the FA Cup.

title.children: Hollywood-backed Wrexham knocks Premier League side out of FA Cup

image.altText: Behind shoulder shot of man holding a tennis racquet.

props.synopsis: Behind the scenes of the world's most elite tennis tournaments there is a team of people working on keeping the majors' racquets well strung.

title.children: Inside the world of stringing tennis racquets

image.altText: Emergency department of hospital with sunset behind it

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory coroner has determined a series of human errors contributed to the 2022 death of an Indigenous woman at Royal Darwin Hospital, in the weeks after she sought a routine surgery.

title.children: 'Chain of errors' contributed to woman's death after routine surgery: coroner

image.altText: A small furry animal with grey hair and whiskers sits amongst twigs

props.synopsis: Five years after feral cats were removed from inside the Western River Refuge on Kangaroo Island, populations of endangered species have boomed.

title.children: 'Predator-free' fence project praised for restoring Kangaroo Island's native wildlife

image.altText: a woman seen in her car wearing a beanie and a jacket

props.synopsis: The new footage, reposted by the White House on social media, was recorded by the agent involved, and reveals the confrontation that led to the shooting as well as him swearing at her immediately afterwards.

title.children: New video emerges of ICE agent shooting woman in Minneapolis

image.altText: A Menorah moved to Bondi Beach by Waverley Council.

props.synopsis: After growing calls for a royal commission into the Bondi terror attack, the prime minister has finally announced it would take place, saying it "was what Australia needs".

title.children: The Bondi royal commission is due to report in April. Here's what we know

image.altText: Beakers water contamination

props.synopsis: The tap water in the Northern Territory town of Katherine — which includes a "designer" mix of river water from the world-famous Nitmiluk National Park and mineral-rich groundwater — has been named Australia's best drop.

title.children: PFAS to perfection: The story behind regional NT town's 'designer' water

image.altText: Baggage stacked against a wall.

props.synopsis: A sixth man is charged over an alleged plot to import half a tonne of cocaine into Western Australia using an international livestock carrier.

title.children: Sixth man charged over alleged livestock carrier cocaine bust

image.altText: A woman in a black strappy top with her hair pulled up into a bun is turned away from the camera.

props.synopsis: New research shows thousands of alcohol products remain on Australian shelves without mandated pregnancy warning labels.

title.children: Mums who drank during pregnancy call for universal alcohol warnings

image.altText: People singing and dancing at the Parkes Elvis Festival.

props.synopsis: Japanese tribute artist Toki Toyokazu is part of a growing international presence at the annual Parkes Elvis Festival, which also includes women.

title.children: English is Toki's second language, but he sings in a classic Elvis drawl
